'''Madoc "Proudneck" Brandybuck''' was a [[Hobbits|Hobbit]] of [[Buckland]].

==History==
Madoc was the son of [[Gormadoc Brandybuck]] and [[Malva Headstrong]]. He married to [[Hanna Goldworthy]] and was the father of [[Marmadoc Brandybuck]]. He served as [[Master of Buckland]] between {{SR|1236}} and {{SR|1277}}.<ref>{{App|Brandybuck}}</ref>

==Etymology==
The meaning of the name ''Madoc'' is unknown. [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] noted that the names of the Bucklanders had a vaguely [[Celtic]] style.<ref name="Translation">{{App|Translation}}, p. 1135</ref>

''Madoc'' is a [[Welsh]] name, which is derived from the element ''mad'' ("fortunate"). According to a tradition a [[Wikipedia:Madoc|Madoc]] who was the son of Owen Gwynedd discovered America around A.D. 1170. A ''Madok de la Montayne'' is mentioned by Malory in ''Le Morte Darthur''.<ref>{{HM|IE}}, "Giving of Names", p. 203</ref>
